name: Niki Mono
aliases: Niki Mono & The Buskers of Tenerife

name: Re:mind
comments: Musical solo project of Hubert Razack

name: Maurice McCall
comments: Songwriter. In the second half of the 1950s McCall was the manager of Biff's Restaurant in Hollywood, near the Gold Star Studios. Between recording sessions Eddie Cochran frequented the restaurant and McCall pitched him songs.

name: Atrocity
comments: Atrocity has ranged stylistically from death metal to gothic rock to ethnometal, among others

name: Abbey Lincoln
comments: Jazz singer, composer.  After a tour of Africa in the mid-1970s, she adopted the name Aminata Moseka.

name: Chumbawamba
comments: Band that constantly shifted in musical style, drawing on genres such as punk rock, pop, folk, and experimental. The band's anarchist or libertarian socialist political stance exhibited an irreverent attitude toward authority.

name: Dani [FR]
comments: Singer, actress and model from in Castres. In 1966 she was contracted to Pathé-Marconi and released her first single. In 1968 "Papa vient d'épouser la bonne" was a major hit and sold over a million copies. In cinema she has played the script-girl Liliane in François Truffaut's "La nuit américaine".

name: Tanya Blount
comments: Soul and R&B music singer and actress

name: Howard Horton
comments: Disc jockey, show promoter, music publisher, songwriter and performer born in Montclair, New Jersey. In the 1930s he worked at Mexican border stations before relocating to the Dallas-Forth Woth area where he hosted  country music radio programs for many years. He also published Hank Thompson's and Eddy Arnold's earliest songs.

name: The Green River Boys
comments: Bluegrass duo of Dale Fitzsimmons (banjo) and Carl Tanberg (bass fiddle), who were active from the 1950s to the 1970s

name: Arthur Smith [US1]
aliases: Arthur 'Guitar Boogie' Smith with His Cracker-Jacks
comments: Composer, musician, entertainer and business entrepreneur. He composed and recorded one of the all-time best selling guitar instrumentals, "Guitar Boogie".

name: Cliffie Stone
aliases: Cliffie Stone and The Country Hombres
Cliffie Stone and His Barn Dance Band
Cliffie Stone and His Barn Dance Orchestra
Cliffie Stone and His Hometown Hepcats
Cliffie Stone and His Hometown Jamboree Gang
comments: Country music singer, musician, record producer, music publisher, and radio and TV personality

name: Dub Taylor
comments: Film and television actor and occasional songwriter.

name: Keith Colley
comments: Songwriter, publisher and recording artist from Spokane, Washington

name: Curtis Smith
comments: Guitarist and songwriter, who collaborated with Piano Red

name: Plus Ones
comments: Pop punk band from East Bay, CA

name: Antiglück
comments: Industrial music band based in Lyon.

name: Bonglab
aliases: Bonglab featuring members of Supreme Beings of Leisure
comments: Electro side project of The Supreme Beings of Leisure

name: Ben Neill
comments: Trumpeter, composer, inventor of the mutantrumpet

name: Dave Wakeling
aliases: The Supreme Beat featuring Dave Wakeling

name: Kim Hoorweg
comments: Jazz vocalist, daughter of jazz pianist Erwin Hoorweg (The Houdini's).

name: Jason Cropper
comments: Musician (guitar), singer and songwriter, born in Oakland, California

name: Grade
comments: Melodic hardcore band from Burlington, Ontario. Since their break-up, Grade have reunited several times.

name: Christopher John
comments: Was a member of the indie/emo band Elliot

name: Favorite Atomic Hero
comments: Alternative rock band from Boston, Massachusetts.

name: Norman Brown
comments: Jazz guitarist and singer, born in Kansas City, Missouri.

name: A.L. Owens
comments: Country music singer and songwriter, inducted into the Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1999

name: Off with Their Heads
aliases: Off with Their Heads - Dear Landlord

name: Modern Machines
comments: Punk rock band from Milwaukee, WI

name: Jason White [US1]
comments: Alt rock and punk pop guitarist and singer born in Little Rock, Arkansas

name: Against Me!
comments: Punk rock band formed in 1997 in Naples, Florida.

name: Vernon Bullock
comments: Soul and R&B singer-songwriter and producer

name: Zero 7
comments: English musical duo consisting of Henry Binns and Sam Hardaker. They began as studio engineers and in 1997 formed the group Zero 7. Their debut album was released in 2001.

name: The Rubinoos
comments: Power pop band from Berkeley, California

name: Michael Alan Fox
comments: Also known as Whölley Smökkes or Stoned Wolf

name: Creighton Lindsay
comments: Lindsay plays guitar and songs in blues and roots music styles.

name: Raymond Moore [US2]
comments: Songwriter in the 1970s and 1980s. Sharing the same IPI code in many PROs, he should not be confused with Raymond Moore [US1] , who composed over 200 songs under this and other pen names and was a friend of John Philip Sousa (1854-1932).

name: Cascada
comments: Dance music trio consisting of DJ/producers Yanou and DJ Manian ,  and singer Natalie Horler

name: Claudio Cecchetto
comments: Record producer, entrepreneur, former DJ and television presenter.

name: Ermanno Parazzini
comments: Songwriter, record producer and talent scout

name: Paul de Senneville
comments: Composer, producer and record label owner

name: Alberto Sordi
comments: Prolific and successful actor, scriptwriter and director. He used irony, pathos and satire to depict the negative traits of the "Average Italian Man" (xenophilia, machismo, corruption, vulgarity, etc.) Most of his films now belong to the canon of the "Commedia all'italiana" genre. Sordi was also a voice actor, a songwriter, and a singer.

name: Monica Vitti
comments: Versatile actress, best known for her starring roles in Michelangelo Antonioni's arthouse films and in many "Commedia all'italiana" movies.

name: Stacey Kent
comments: Jazz vocalist born in South Orange, New Jersey, and based in England

name: The Casanovas
comments: Hard rock band formed in 1999, based in Melbourne.

name: Roger Chapman
comments: English rock vocalist also known as Chappo, who is best known as a member of the progressive rock band Family, which he joined along with Charlie Whitney in 1966 and also the rock, R&B band Streetwalkers formed in 1974. He became a cult figure on the British rock scene, but since the early 1980s he has spent much of his time in Germany and has made occasional appearances there and elsewhere.

name: Dick Kniss
comments: Folk and jazz bassist and songwriter

name: Mike Taylor [US]
comments: Guitarist and songwriter, best known for his artistic collaboration with John Denver . He was also active as an archaeologist and historian.

name: Pat Fish
comments: Musician, member of the band The Jazz Butcher (applied ambiguously both to Fish and the whole band)

name: Jerry Cole
comments: Guitarist, who recorded under his own name, under various budget album pseudonyms and as an uncredited session musician.

name: Smokey Stover [US2]
aliases: Smokey Stover and His Original Firemen All-Stars
comments: Jazz trumpeter and occasional vocalist born in Conrad, Iowa

name: Jermaine Paul
comments: Former R&B backing vocal, Paul won the second season of NBC's talent show, The Voice, in the spring of 2012.

name: Consorzio Suonatori Indipendenti
comments: Art-rock band formed by Giovanni Lindo Ferretti and Massimo Zamboni after the disbandment of CCCP.

name: Kaballà
comments: Singer-songwriter from Caltagirone (Catania). His solo works blend pop music with Sicilian traditions. As a lyricist, he has collaborated with many Italian artists and with operatic pop acts from all over the world.

name: Lula [IT]
comments: Rock band featuring Amerigo Verardi, Gino Calora and Massimo Calora.

name: Bluvertigo
comments: Synth pop band formed by Marco Castoldi (aka Morgan) and Andrea Fumagalli in the 1980's and disbanded in 2016.

name: Os Incríveis
comments: Rock band. Part of the ''Jovem Guarda'' movement.

name: Vanusa
comments: Singer, linked to the Jovem Guarda movement

name: North Mississippi Allstars
comments: Blues band formed in 1996 from Hernando, Mississippi.

name: William Blake
comments: English 18th century romantic poet and painter

name: Gail Collins
comments: Lyricist. In 1983 she shot her husband Felix Pappalardi and was charged with second degree murder, but eventually found guilty of criminally negligent homicide.

name: Linton Kwesi Johnson
comments: Jamaican born but now resident in the UK; author and dub poet

name: Adam Franklin
comments: Alternative rock guitarist, singer, and songwriter

name: Polar
comments: Band from Valencia formed in 1994. Miguel M. Matallin - guitar, vocals Jesus De Santos - guitar, vocals Paco Grande - bass guitar Jesus Saez - drums

name: Sharron Kraus
comments: English singer, songwriter and musician with strong ties to the U.S. Sharron Kraus was born in New York, but grew up in Leicester, England. She has lived in Philadelphia, PA and collaborated with American musicians, including Meg Baird, Helena Espvall, Christian Kiefer (as The Black Dove), Tara Burke (as Tau Emerald), and Gillian Chadwick (as Rusalnaia) .

name: Billy Price
aliases: Billy Price and The Keystone Rhythm Band
comments: American soul singer, born in Fair Lawn, NJ. Before going solo, he was the vocalist for the Roy Buchanan Band.

name: The Peanuts
comments: Pop duo consisting of twin sisters Emi and Yumi Itō.

name: Takashi Otowa
comments: Pen name used by King Records employees when translating foreign songs into Japanese. At least four or five people have used it, although the only one whose identity is known for certain is 牧野 剛 (Go Makino, 1925 - 2009). King Records main office was located in Otowa, Bunkyō-ku, Tokyo.

name: Sandro Taccani
comments: Composer, best known for his composition "Come Prima"

name: Dominique
comments: Singer active at the end of the 1950s and the 1960s, who often accompanied trumpeter Georges Jouvin

name: Felt
comments: Jangle pop band, formed in in Water Orton

name: Venus Peter
comments: Britpop / Shoegaze band from Tokyo, heavily influenced by the Madchester scene.

name: Daily Planet
comments: Pop instrumental group from San Sebastian

name: Mumbly
comments: Pop group: Michaël Korchia (bass), Pierre Boucher de Crèvecœur [aka Pit] (guitar, vocals), Aurore Bacmann (guitar, vocals)

name: Nelson Eddy
comments: Classically-trained baritone and actor who appeared in musical films during the 1930s and 1940s, as well as in opera and on the concert stage, radio, television and in nightclubs.

name: Dad's Porno Mag
comments: Los Angeles-based rock band around singer and guitarist Ryan Roxie.

name: Three Alarm Fire
comments: Rock quartet from Los Angeles that recorded and toured with Duran Duran's John Taylor during his solo career. The band featured singer Melanie Friedman, guitarist Mick McCarthy, keyboardist Arlan Scheirbaum, bassist Tad Dery, and drummer D.J. Bonebrake.

name: Xan Cassavetes
comments: Actress and director. Daughter of Hollywood actor John Cassavetes.

name: Jawbox
comments: Indie band based in the Washington, D.C. area

name: Orquestra Taller de Músics de Barcelona
comments: Orchestra of Taller de Músics label

name: Jennifer Leitham
comments: Jazz acoustic bassist, Leitham plays left handed.  Leitham transitioned from John Leitham in 2001 and is the subject of "I Stand Corrected" that won the 2012 best documentary award at the American Documentary Film Festival.  Leitham is also a composer and lyricist and sometime vocalist.

name: Alex Riel
comments: Jazz and rock drummer and composer

name: The Blue Wisp Big Band
comments: A regional ensemble from Cincinnati  formed in 1980 plays jazz and big band music.

name: Eugene Pao
comments: Jazz guitarist, besides releasing in his own right also co-operating with a. o. Herbie Hancock, Jimmy Witherspoon, Jack DeJohnette, Chick Corea and Kazumi Watanabe.

name: Jim Cifelli
aliases: The Jim Cifelli New York Nonet

name: Buell Kazee
comments: Old-Time and Appalachian music singer, banjoist, composer, author and minister born in Burton Fork, Kentucky

name: Elli Medeiros
comments: Punk and elektropop singer and actress

name: And Also The Trees
comments: Post-punk band formed in the Worcestershire countryside

name: Chuck Blackwell
comments: Drummer and percussionist, who played drums for The Everly Brothers , Little Richard and Jerry Lee Lewis and recorded with Taj Mahal, Freddie King and Leon Russell.

name: Rosie O'Donnell
comments: Comedian, actress, author and television personality

name: Spook Handy
comments: Folksinger from New Jersey in the Woody Guthrie and Pete Seeger mode.  In fact, between 2003 and 2013 Handy played alongside Pete Seeger on more than 50 occasions.

name: Danny [FI]
comments: Singer with a long career in Finnish popular music. His backing singers are called "D'Voices" and also known as "Danny's Angels".

name: Jesse Garon & The Desperadoes
comments: Twee pop band from Edinburgh, Scotland.

name: Fantastic Something
comments: UK-based duo made up of two US-born Greek-born brothers

name: Mikel Laboa
comments: One of the Basque Country's most important singer-songwriters

name: Doretta Morrow
comments: American actress, singer, and dancer who appeared in stage and television productions during the 1940s and 1950s. She is best remembered for creating roles in the original productions of three successful Broadway musicals: Kitty Verdun in Where's Charley? (1948), Tuptim in " The King and I (1951) and Marsinah in Kismet (1953).

name: Robert Wright [US1]
comments: Composer and lyricist. Wright collaborated with George Forrest for more than 70 years - frequently adapting classical composers’ music, to create some 2,000 songs featured in 16 stage musicals, 18 revues, and 58 movies, as well as a number of cabaret acts. Among their best-known musicals were "Song of Norway" (1944), the Tony Award-winning "Kismet" (1953), and "Grand Hotel" (1989).

name: George Forrest
comments: Composer and lyricist. Forrest collaborated with his partner Robert Craig Wright for more than 70 years - frequently adapting classical composers’ music, to create some 2,000 songs featured in 16 stage musicals, 18 revues, and 58 movies, as well as a number of cabaret acts. Among their best-known musicals were "Song of Norway" (1944), the Tony Award-winning "Kismet" (1953), and "Grand Hotel" (1989).

name: Dannii Minogue
comments: Singer, actress, model, TV personality and stylist. Her  music career began in the early 1990s after she signed a recording contract with Australian-based Mushroom Records in January 1989.

name: The Raunch Hands
comments: Garage rock band from New York City

name: Ellen McIlwaine
comments: Blues singer-songwriter and slide guitarist based in Canada since 1987 (first Toronto, later Calgary)

name: Baby Jail
comments: Alternative pop-rock group singing in Swiss German. Disbanded in 1994 and then reformed in 2012.

name: Joe Dolce
comments: American-born singer and songwriter, born in Painesville, Ohio

name: Werly Fairburn
aliases: Werly Fairburn and The Detla Boys

name: David and Jonathan
comments: Vocal duo consisting of David (= Roger Cook) and Jonathan (= Roger Greenaway). Active from 1965 till 1968.

name: Bob Young
comments: Musician and songwriter; the unofficial fifth member of the rock band Status Quo

name: Elektric Music
comments: Former Kraftwerk members Karl Bartos & Emil Schult .

name: Vanilla Sky
comments: Pop punk band from Rome, formed in February 2002.

name: The Big Dirty Band
comments: Supergroup put together to support  the Trailer Park Boys: The Movie, which premiered October 6, 2006. They contributed one song to the soundtrack and played at the film premiere.

name: The Impossibles [GB]
comments: Indie rock and dance music duo

name: Popinjays
comments: Indie pop band from London, active between 1988 and 1994.

name: Big Black
comments: Punk rock band from Evanston, Illinois founded by singer and guitarist Steve Albini.

name: Ben Crabbé
comments: Musician (drummer), songwriter, presenter and TV producer

name: The Aislers Set
comments: Indie pop band from San Francisco.

name: Dean
comments: Pop-rock music singer Season 3 winner of the Belgian edition of Idool

name: Sean Sennett
aliases: Sean Sennett  & The Honey Trap Combo
comments: Pop singer, songwriter and music journalist.

name: Stefaan Fernande
comments: Backing vocalist, prolific songwriter, producer and synthesizer player

name: Columbia Stellar Quartette
aliases: Charles Harrison and Columbia Stellar Quartette
comments: Vocal group whose original members were John Barnes Wells, Frank Croxton, Charles Harrison and Andrea Sarto. In 1915 Wells was replaced briefly by Henry Burr. Burr was replaced by Reed Miller.

name: The Killjoys
comments: Band from Melbourne formed in 1987 feat. Anna Burley and Craig Pilkington.

name: The Drunk, the Monk & the Spunk
Dave Gahan
comments: Mainly known as Depeche Mode's singer and frontman, but also a solo artist in his own rights.

name: Mavis Piggott
comments: Post-grunge trio based in Seattle. Guitarist and vocalist Meghan Adkins teamed up with drummer Nicole "Nicky" Thomas to form the band. Bassist John Wickhart was added to the lineup to complete the trio.

name: Deneuve
comments: Electronic musician and techno music pioneer.

name: Godflesh
comments: Pioneering industrial metal act from Birmingham, formed in 1988.

name: Simon Fisher Turner
comments: Composer, soundscapes and -tracks creator, producer and arranger

name: Gerd Müller-Schwanke
comments: Lyricist and vocalist born in Kiel

name: John's Children
comments: 1960s pop art / mod rock band from Leatherhead, England that briefly featured future T. Rex frontman Marc Bolan. John's Children were active for less than two years and were not very successful commercially. But they had a big influence on punk rock and are seen by some as the precursors of glam rock.

name: The Pooh Sticks
comments: Indie pop band from Swansea, Wales.

name: The Mad Scene
comments: Jangle pop band founded in Auckland/New Zealand

name: How to Swim
comments: Six-piece chamber pop band from Glasgow

name: Pale Horse and Rider
comments: Alt-country and slowcore project of Jon DeRosa and Marc Gartman

name: Kid Dakota
comments: Minneapolis based band, essentially the musical moniker of the South Dakota-born songwriter and engineer Darren Jackson.

name: Jessica Bailiff
comments: Slowcore and shoegaze singer-songwriter from Toledo, OH

name: Miguel Fleta
aliases: Miguel Fleta acomp. de orquesta bajo direccíon del Maestro Gelabert

name: Eagle
comments: Glam power pop band formed in Los Angeles

name: Sugarfree [US]
comments: with members Chris Remington, Robbie Pinna and Stephen Bliss

name: Peter Skellern
comments: Singer-songwriter and pianist, born in Bury

name: Cinema Strange
comments: Gothic punk / death rock band from California, founded by the brothers Daniel and Michael Ribiat

name: Corpus Delicti
comments: Goth band. It became the industrial band "Corpus" in the late 1990s.

name: Cybernauts
comments: Formed by members of Def Leppard/former members of Bowie bands.

name: Let It Burn
comments: Hardcore Punk band from Point Pleasant Beach, New Jersey

name: Adriano Pappalardo
comments: Singer, actor and television personality, known for his powerful, raspy voice.

name: Rudy Taylor
comments: Soul and funk producer and songwriter

name: Superfunk
comments: 3 DJ's from Marseille bringing funky house music. Fafa Monteco left de group in 2005. Stephane B died in 2020.

name: James Lee Stanley
comments: Singer and songwriter based in Southern California.

name: Amy Lynn Williams
comments: Soul singer, active in the late 60's - early 70's in the Miami soul scene

name: The Popguns
comments: Indie pop band. Originally from Brighton, they formed in 1986 and were active till 1996. 2012 saw the band resume live performances.

name: Muriel Smith
comments: Singer-actress. Smith had several Broadway roles, then moved to the UK in 1949 and continued on the stage as well as making recordings. She returned to the US circa 1955, where her work included dubbing for actresses in major films. Notable musical stage roles include Carmen in "Carmen Jones" (Broadway),  Lady Thiang in "The King and I" (London) and Bloody Mary in "South Pacific" (London).

name: Ai Phoenix
comments: Under the leadership of Mona Mørk's tranquil lyricism and breathy delivery, Ai Phoenix formed in Bergen, Norway, in 1997. Dedicated to lush soundscapes and bittersweet classic pop sentiment, the quintet is filled out by Patrick Lundberg, Bosse Litzheim, Espen Mellingen, and Robert Jønnum.

name: Skid Row [US]
comments: Metal band formed in New Jersey

name: Robbie Robertson
aliases: Robbie Robertson & The Red Road Ensemble
comments: Rock singer, guitarist, songwriter, film composer, producer, actor, and author born in Toronto

name: Kate Ryan
comments: Singer and songwriter, born in Tessenderlo. She represented Belgium on the 51st edition of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place in Athens, Greece. She did not qualify for the final, finishing two places outside the advancing Top 10 (12th) with 69 points.

name: Nino Buonocore
comments: Singer-songwriter from Naples. Buonocore began as a record producer and session musician in the late 1970's. His first albums were heavily influenced by new wave and synth-pop, but he found success in the second half of the 1980's with a series of sophisti-pop songs, such as Rosanna and Scrivimi. After an ill-fated appearance at the 1993 Sanremo Festival, he abandoned the pop music scene for about five years. In 2001, he made his comeback with a jazz sextet, performing new songs as well as jazz arrangements of older hits.

name: Surf Mariachis
comments: Group of session musiciancs from California, featuring Conte Candoli (trumpet), Tom Scott, (sax), Jay Migliori (sax), Billy Strange (guitar) and Frankie Capp (percussion).

name: Rafael Hernández
aliases: Rafael Hernández y su Orquesta del Grillon
comments: Composer of Puerto Rican popular music and one of Puerto Rico's most famous sons. John F. Kennedy gave him the nickname "Mr. Cumbanchero". Puerto Rico has honored his memory by naming public buildings, avenues and schools after him. The airport of Aguadilla is named after him:  Rafael Hernández Airport

name: Tito Puente
aliases: Tito Puente (El Rey del Timbal) y su conjunto
Tito Puente (El Rey del Timbal) y su orquesta
Tito Puente and His Concert Orchestra
Tito Puente His Latin Ensemble and Orchestra
Tito Puente's Golden Latin Jazz All Stars
comments: Puente was born in New York City of Puerto Rican parents, living in Spanish Harlem. He was a timbales and vibraphone player, composer and band leader.  Puente played Latin jazz, Afro-Cuban, and salsa music.

name: Bert Kaempfert
comments: Composer, arranger, conductor, band-leader and producer from Hamburg He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1993.

name: Jack Costanzo
aliases: Jack Costanzo and His Afro-Cuban Band
comments: Percussionist, known as 'Mr. Bongo', and bandleader

name: Dario Baldan Bembo
comments: Composer, singer-songwriter, music arranger and musician

name: The Phantom Surfers
comments: Surf rock band based in San Francisco

name: Fifty Foot Combo
comments: Garage surf, rock 'n' roll, and exotica band.

name: Duane Eddy
aliases: Duane Eddy - His 'Twangy' Guitar and The Rebels
Duane Eddy, His 'Twangy' Guitar and The Rebels
Duane Eddy His 'Twangy' Guitar and The Rebels
Duane Eddy and The Rebels featuring The Rebelettes

name: The Fender IV
comments: Surf rock band, playing mainly instrumental music. Active from the summer of 1963 till May 1965. Soon after the band changed its name to The Sons of Adam , playing more in a garage rock style.

name: Kris Kristofferson
comments: Singer, songwriter and actor, who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1985 and was also the 2006 recipient of The Johnny Mercer Award, the SHoF’s highest honor

name: Chico Buarque
comments: Author and musician, born in Rio de Janeiro

name: $10,000 Gold Chain
comments: One off project for the Cable Guy soundtrack. Other members: Tyler Willman (Green Apple Quick Step, Inspector Luv) vocals, Tim Dijulio (Lazy Susan) guitar, Mari Anne Braeden bass, Chris Friel (Shadow, El Stiener) drums.

name: Poppys
comments: French popgroup consisting of 17 children. The boys were selected from the Chorale Des Petits Chanteurs D'Asnières by Gilles Péram

name: Everclear
comments: Alternative / power pop band from Portland, Oregon.

name: Yes
comments: Inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2017 (Performers)

name: Laura Nyro
comments: Piano-based singer-songwriter who combined elements of pop, rock, R&B, and soul

name: Don Cherry [US1]
comments: Popular and big band singer who became a professional golfer

name: Bernard Ighner
comments: Jazz singer, multi-instrumentalist, songwriter, arranger and producer

name: Sammy Davis Jr.
aliases: Olga James And Sammy Davis Jr.

name: Michele Lee
comments: Best known as an actress, Lee has appeared on Broadway, film, and television.  She played Karen Cooper Fairgate MacKenzie in the prime time soap opera "Knots Landing", in which role she won six Soap Opera Digest awards.  Lee is also a singer, dancer, director, and producer.

name: Billy Ray Cyrus
comments: Country singer, songwriter, guitarist and actor

name: The Fugs
comments: Satirical and self-satirizing rock band. Active until 1969, The Fugs reunited several times for concerts.

name: Marc Cohn
comments: Vocalist with smart blend of introspective pop with detours through Americana

name: Earth & Fire
comments: Rock and pop band formed by twin brothers Chris and Gerard Koerts

name: City [DE]
comments: One of the most successful bands from the former GDR

name: Goran Bregović
aliases: The Goran Bregović Wedding and Funeral Orchestra

name: Bobby Timmons
comments: Jazz pianist who played, among others, mainstream, hard bop and soul jazz.  Timmons was also a composer.

name: L. A. Style
comments: Techno duo formed by Denzil Slemming and Wessel van Diepen

name: Toots Thielemans
comments: Jazz guitarist, harmonica player, whistler and composer, also of scores. Settled in the US in 1952 and got US citizen in 1957. Thielemans throughout his long career played and co-operated with a broad range of artists.

name: Horace Silver
comments: Jazz pianist and composer. He was born on the island of Maio, one of the Cape Verde Islands. His mother was of Irish and Negro descent, his father of Portuguese origin.

name: Harold Nicholas
comments: Tap dancer, theater director and choreographer

name: [Traditional]
comments: This page gathers all traditional songs.

name: The Springfields [US]
comments: Indie-pop band from Illinois, active in the late 1980s and later evolving into Velvet Crush .

name: The Pastels [GB]
comments: Indie pop-rock band from Glasgow, Scotland

name: Irving Roth
comments: Songwriter, composer, conductor, saxophonist, clarinetist, oboist, and English horn player

name: Jesse James [US1]
comments: Soul singer, songwriter and record label owner

name: Jean-Philippe Rameau
comments: One of the most important French composers and music theorists of the Baroque era.

name: Janette Carter
comments: Folk and country music singer and guitarist

name: Stewart Family
comments: Country gospel family band from Blytheville, Arkansas. Led by Pappy Stewart, the group was popular for a short time in the early 1950s.

name: Felice Taylor
comments: Soul singer. She began singing with her sisters Norma and Darlene in a trio, The Sweets.

name: Catherine Ringer
comments: Singer-songwriter, musician, dancer, choreographer and actress

name: Baby Boy Warren
comments: Blues guitarist and songwriter from Detroit

name: Willie Cobbs
comments: Blues singer, harmonica player and songwriter from Smale, Arkansas, based in Chicago

name: The Jodimars
comments: Rock and roll band that was formed in the summer of 1955 and remained active until 1958. The band was created by former members of Bill Haley & His Comets who had quit that group in a salary dispute.

name: Frank Pingatore
comments: Musician, band leader, songwriter, composer and arranger from Wilmington, Delaware.

name: Eddie Fontaine
comments: Rock 'n' Roll singer from Jersey City, New Jersey.

name: Cirino Colacrai
comments: Brooklyn, New York, born multi-instrumentalist, singer and songwriter.

name: Leo Wood
comments: Songwriter and musical comedy producer, who also wrote under the name of Jack Wood. He married the former Gertrude George, a contralto and vaudeville performer.  In 1923 they appeared in "The Radio Widow," the first sketch ever to be presented on the radio. It was written and composed by Leo Wood.

name: Gus Arnheim
aliases: Gus Arnheim and His Ambassador Hotel Cocoanut Grove Orchestra
Gus Arnheim and His Ambassador Hotel Orchestra
Gus Arnheim and His Cocoanut Grove Orchestra

name: Abe Lyman
aliases: Abe Lyman's California Ambassador Hotel Orchestra
comments: Popular bandleader from the 1920s into the 1940s

name: Al J. Neiburg
comments: Lyricist and owner of a publishing company

name: Lester Williams
comments: Texas blues and electric blues guitarist, singer and songwriter. Williams released several singles in the 1950s, but remained a stalwart of the Houston blues circuit for decades. His recording career lasted from 1949 to 1956.

name: Pensive
comments: Pop punk band from San Diego, CA

name: Judy Lindsey
comments: Country singer who attended North Texas State University and then took a job at the Bauder Fashion College where she taught modelling and psychology

name: Eddie Hall
comments: Rhythm guitarist and occasional bass player

name: The Nettles Sisters
aliases: The Nettles Sisters with The Rodeo Tune Wranglers
comments: Vocal duo consisting of sisters, Mary and Jeanie Nettles

name: Piet Jorens
comments: Drummer, mostly used as a studio musician.

name: Lincoln Mayorga
comments: Pianist, conductor and composer, who has worked in rock and roll, pop, jazz and classical music

name: Supermika
comments: Pop band from Bordeaux started by Mikaël Larrieu / Supermika (guitar / vocals), soon joined by Sèverine Faramond / Sylverine (vocals). They frequently toured with additional musicians, while recording songs for various compilations. The band returned to a duet and changed their name for Shoubi or not ? from 2008 to 2011.

name: Aaron Zeitlin
comments: Aaron Zeitlin was born in Belarus, spent his early years in Vilna, Lithuania and moved to the United States in 1939. He was a poet, wrote plays for the theater, and taught Hebrew Literature at the Jewish Theological Seminary.

name: Arthur Kevess
comments: Mainly a lyricist and translator of German and Yiddish songs. Also an active Human Rights Activist.

name: Teddi Schwartz
comments: Yiddish singer, performer on stage, radio and television. She has authored several books and articles on music and has served as a choral director.

name: Mike Anthony
comments: Pop and country & western music composer from NYC

name: Dana Valery
comments: Born in Italy, raised in South Africa

name: Summer Factory
comments: Rock quintet started in Lille but is established in Bordeaux

name: DJ Zebra
comments: Bass player in "Billy Ze Kick Et Les Gamins En Folie", "Les Raggamins" & "Demain Les Poulpes", singer-songwriter, DJ

name: Family [GB1]
comments: Psychedelia and progressive rock band from Leicester, England

name: John Whitney [GB]
comments: English rock guitarist and a founder member of the rock bands Family, Streetwalkers and Axis Point

name: The Celibate Rifles
comments: Australian punk rock band founded in 1979 in Sydney.

name: Harem Scarem [CA]
comments: Hard rock band from Toronto; disbanded in 2008 and then reformed in 2013

name: Chuck Mead
aliases: Chuck Mead & His Grassy Knoll Boys
comments: Alternative Country and Americana musician, producer and songwriter

name: Shaw Wilson
comments: Drummer born in Topeka, KS and co-founder of the country rock band BR5-49.

name: Smelly Tongues
comments: Alternative Rock Band from the late 1980's.

name: Hullabaloo
comments: merican punk / grunge band from Boston, Massachusetts founded in 1986, now disbanded.

name: Coffin Break
comments: Hardcore punk band founded in Seattle, Washington.

name: Instigators
comments: Anarcho Punk band from Dewsbury, United Kingdom formed in 1980

name: Billy Crawford
comments: Filipino-American singer-songwriter, actor, TV host and comedian

name: Morris Bailey, Jr.
comments: Philadelphia songwriter, composer, multi-instrumentalist, producer, label owner and arranger

name: Leon Mitchell
comments: Saxophonist, composer, and arranger from Philadelphia, PA

name: Arif Mardin
comments: Turkish-American record company executive and producer born in Istanbul

name: Larry Murray
comments: Folk and country singer, guitarist, songwriter, and producer from Waycross, Georgia

name: Digby Richards
aliases: Dig Richards and The R' Jays
Dig Richards with The R' Jays
Dig Richards with The R' Jays and Chorus
comments: Rock 'n' roll, pop and country singer and songwriter

name: Pussycat
comments: Group from Limburg fronted by the three sisters Toni Willé, Betty Dragstra and Marianne Hensen, whose maiden name was Veldpaus. Their song "Mississippi" was a #1 hit in most European countries, including the UK, in the 1970s.

name: Werner Theunissen
comments: Heerlen-born musician (guitar), composer and lyricist of the 70s Dutch country music band "Pussycat". He rose to fame when his song "Mississippi", released by the band in 1975, became an international hit and sold an estimated 7 million copies worldwide.

name: Piet Veerman
aliases: Piet Veerman and The New Cats

name: Barbie Gaye
comments: Singer from Brooklyn, New York. She was just 14 years old when she recorded the original version of "My Boy Lollipop."

name: Millie
comments: Singer and songwriter. My Boy Lollipop was the first Jamaican single to sell one million copies and Mayfair was one of the first covers of a Nick Drake song.

name: John Scott Trotter
aliases: John Scott Trotter and His Orchestra

name: A.N.I.M.A.L.
comments: A.N.I.M.A.L. (Acosados Nuestros Indios Murieron Al Luchar) (meaning: Harassed, Our Indians Died While Fighting) is an Alternative metal band. The band's sound is a combination of thrash metal, groove metal and Ñü metal, and most lyrics deal with issues of ethnic minorities and indigenous people of Latin America. The band experienced commercial success in the mid-to-late 1990s and toured throughout a number of Latin American countries, the United States and Europe, and also opened for numerous big names from the worldwide rock and metal scene. A.N.I.M.A.L. was disbanded in 2006 and reformed in 2015.

name: Comateens
comments: Formed in New York by Ramona Jan (guitar), Nik North (bass, vocals), and a drum machine. After Lyn Byrd (synthesizer, vocals) and Oliver North (guitar, vocals) joined the group, they recorded their self-titled debut LP in 1981. Byrd and Nicholas West eventually reunited in West and Byrd, after North passed away.

name: David Munday
comments: Synth-rock and pop singer-songwriter and musician.

name: Liane Foly
comments: Jazz and blues singer, actress, presenter and impressionist

name: Adam Mitchell
comments: Toronto-based singer-songwriter born in Glasgow, Scotland

name: Marbles [GB1]
comments: Vocal rock duo: Graham Bonnet & Trevor Gordon

name: Lounge
comments: Punk rock band from New York

name: J.D. Miller [US1]
comments: Record producer, songwriter, musician.  Although Miller said his favorite music was blues and he worked with black artists, he professed to being a segregationist, and formed the label Reb Rebel in the mid-1960s, which issued records by white supremacists.

name: Girlschool
comments: Heavy metal band, formed in 1978 in London. They are the longest running all-female rock band, still active after more than 35 years.

name: Forms of Things Unknown
comments: Forms Of Things Unknown (or FOTU) was launched as a solo studio project in 2002 by San Francisco composer / multi-instrumentalist / DJ Ferrara Brain Pan.

name: Jack Anglin
comments: Country music singer, guitarist, and songwriter

name: Eddie Hill
aliases: Smilin' Eddie Hill and His Boys
Smilin' Eddie Hill with The Tennessee Mountain Boys
comments: Country music singer and disk jockey

name: Ace Ochs
comments: Lyricist, also know as Lee Kaydan

name: Joe Washburne
comments: Joe "Country" Washburne was a singer, musician (bass and tuba), and songwriter from Houston, Texas. In the mid 1940s he was musical director of the NBC radio network "Saturday Night Roundup" show featuring Roy Rogers and The Sons of the Pioneers.

name: Rusty Kershaw
comments: Cajun, country and blues singer and songwriter

name: Adam Wade
comments: Singer, actor and musician from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. He was a research assistant to Dr. Jonas Salk prior to traveling to New York City to pursue a career in music.

name: Rayvon
comments: Reggae singer and DJ, based in Brooklyn, New York (USA)

name: April March
comments: Singer-songwriter, who sings in both English and French

name: Califone
comments: Experimental rock and alt-country band formed in 1997 in Chicago, IL, now being based in Los Angeles, CA. After the breakup of his former band Red Red Meat, frontman Tim Rutili formed Califone initially as a solo project, which evolved into a musical project with a rotating list of contributors, including former members of Red Red Meat and members of other Chicago experimental bands.

name: Mats Paulson
comments: Folky political and christian singer/songwriter, acoustic guitarist and painter

name: United Rhythms of Brazil
aliases: United Rhythms of Brazil feat. Duette

name: Betty O'Hara
comments: Brass player, composer, arranger and singer. She worked as a studio musician, played in jazz groups (primarily on the valve trombone) and was a founding member of the Maiden Voyage Big Band and The Jazzbirds.

name: Striking Distance
comments: Hardcore punk band from Washington, DC

name: Lee Towers
comments: Popular vocalist known for Las Vegas-style shows

name: Oscar Brand
comments: Canadian-born, Brand was a naturalized citizen of the United States.  He was a songwriter, folk singer and author.  Brand was the host of "Oscar Brand's Folksong Festival on WYNC since 1945.

name: The Spencer Davis Group
comments: Legendary 1960s band formed in Birmingham in 1963, which had two UK #1 hits and one UK #2 hit in 1965 and 1966. Steve Winwood left in 1967 to form Traffic. After releasing a few more singles the band ceased to be active in 1968. Davis refounded the group on two more occasions - without the involvement of the Winwood brothers - first in 1973–1974 for two more albums and again from 2006, since when they have primarily been a touring act.

name: Jérôme Soligny
comments: Musician, composer, writer, journalist, and translator

name: The Venus in Furs
comments: Fictional group brought together for the film "Velvet Goldmine", with Jonathan Rhys Meyers' character Brian Slade as vocalist.

name: Jason Crest
comments: Popsike group from Tonbridge, Kent in the south-east of England who released five singles for Philips in the late 1960s.

name: Bertrand Burgalat
comments: Producer, musician, songwriter and label owner. Known internationally for his retrofuturistic style.

name: Apollo XI
comments: One off collaboration Etienne Charry , Bertrand Burgalat & Mathieu Ballet

name: Jacqui Naylor
comments: Vocalist, singing straight ahead jazz, folk-rock and adult alternative based in San Francisco

name: Tom Marshall
comments: Singer-songwriter, keyboarder and vocalist. Best known for contributing the lyrics to most of Phish'es original songs.

name: Amfibian
comments: Musical project led by Tom Marshall

name: Original Mirrors
comments: New wave band formed in Liverpool

name: Gumball
comments: Alternative rock band formed in New York City. Members: Don Fleming, Jay Spiegel, Eric Vermillion, and Malcolm Riviera.

name: The Punch Line
comments: Alternative pop band from New York

name: When People Were Shorter and Lived Near the Water
comments: Experimental/psychedelic band that played deconstructed covers based in New York City. Featuring Kim M. Rancourt, Joey DeFilipps, Bob Meetsma, David Raymer, Dave Rick, David Light and Chris Xefos.

name: Tesco Vee
comments: Former public school teacher in Williamston, Michigan, a suburb of Lansing, and co-founder of Touch and Go Records.  In 1983, Vee move to Washington, D.C., and concentrated on his band, The Meatmen, in which he was the lead singer.  In 1999, Vee returned to Lansing.

name: Jean Grémillon
comments: Film director, writer, author, musician and composer

name: Eddie Burns [US]
comments: Eddie "Guitar" Burns was a blues singer, guitarist, harmonica player and songwriter. He was born in Mississippi and moved to Detroit in 1948.

name: Inspecter 7
comments: American ska band formed in 1992 in New Brunswick, New Jersey.

name: Peter Cincotti
comments: Jazz singer, songwriter, and pianist from New York City

name: Geoff Goddard
comments: Musician, singer, and songwriter, who worked extensively with Joe Meek for R.G.M. Sound in early 1960s

name: Lys Gauty
comments: Cabaret singer and actress. Her most significant work was in the 1930s and 1940s when she appeared in films and recorded her best-known song "Le chaland qui passe"

name: Robson & Jerome
comments: English pop duo active in the mid-1990s and consisting of actors Green and Flynn, who rose to prominence via British television series "Soldier Soldier". In November 1994, in an episode of the UK television drama they performed "Unchained Melody" as an impromptu duo The Unrighteous Brothers. Their cover of this song was released as a double A-side single with "White Cliffs of Dover". It immediately reached #1 and stayed there for seven weeks to become the best-selling song of 1995 in the UK.

name: Gordon [SE]
comments: Ska band from Gothenburg active during the mid 1990s

name: Dr. Ring-Ding
aliases: Dr. Ring-Ding & The Senior All Stars
Dr. Ring Ding & Sharp Axe Band and Friends

name: The Crooked Beat
comments: Swedish ska band from the city of Sundbyberg

name: Skanksters
comments: A Norwegian ska band, formed in 1992

name: Saint Privat
comments: Lounge downtempo project by Austrians Klaus Waldeck and Valérie Sajdik

name: Tim Hagans
comments: Jazz trumpeter born in Dayton, Ohio.

name: Andy Abraham
comments: Runner-up in the second UK series of TV talent show The X Factor in 2005. Also represented the United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest 2008.

name: The Blue Diamonds [NL]
comments: Musical duo, best known for their million-selling chart-topping single "Ramona", which sold some 20 million copies worldwide.

name: Riem de Wolff
comments: Singer and guitarist born in Depok on Java (former Dutch Indies).

name: The Delicates
comments: Three-girl singing group from Belleville, New Jersey. Formed in 1959 when all members were still in high school.

name: Lew Stone
aliases: Lew Stone and His Nova Tones
Lew Stone and The Monseigneur Band
comments: Jazz pianist, bassist, cellist, arranger and dance band leader of one of the most popular bands in England in the 1930s. Stone was also musical director of British and Dominion Films from late 1931 until 1934.

name: Hugh Williams
comments: Austrian composer, pianist, and conductor born in Vienna. In 1921 he was appointed conductor of the Mannheim Opera, but returned to Vienna in 1922, where he worked as a pianist and composer. From 1927 he was the artistic manager of the Ultraphone Gramophone company in Berlin and In 1933 he became conductor of the "Kammerspiele Theater" in Vienna. Forced to flee his native land because of the Nazi takeover Grosz resettled in England in 1934. However, he found little interest there for his avant garde musical style. He was able to apply a considerable melodic gift to setting the lyrics of popular songs, some of which became international successes. Most of his most popular titles were written with lyricist Jimmy Kennedy: "Harbour Lights", "Red Sails in the Sunset", "When Budapest Was Young", and "Isle of Capri".

name: Glenn Sutton
comments: Country music songwriter, who wrote or co-wrote numerous major country hits for Tammy Wynette, David Houston, Lynn Anderson, Jerry Lee Lewis and others, and producer.

name: The Crowd [US]
comments: Punk rock band from Huntington Beach, California

name: Stuart Hamblen
aliases: Stuart Hamblen and His Covered Wagon Jubilee
Stuart Hamblen and His Lucky Stars

name: Dean Wareham
comments: Wellington born guitarist, singer, songwriter and score composer

name: Silvania
comments: Electronic / shoegaze duo from Peru living in Spain

name: ISAN
comments: a.k.a. isan, Integrated Services Analogue Network.

name: Dune [DE]
comments: Electronic music group. The band took its name from the "Dune" series of science fiction novels by Frank Herbert.

name: Dysmorfic
comments: DIY grindcore band from Mantua, Lombardy

name: Sugar Pie DeSanto
comments: Rhythm and blues singer, active since the early 1950s, songwriter, band leader, and record producer

name: Alvin Parham
comments: Rhythm & blues singer, guitarist, and songwriter.

name: Fabienne Delsol
comments: Garage rock and psychedelic pop singer

name: Io e i Gomma Gommas
comments: Comedy/punk rock cover band, inspired by Me First and The Gimme Gimmes .

name: Antoine
comments: Singer, popular in the in the sixties and seventies, who has both the Italian and the French nationality.

name: Lincoln Center Jazz Orchestra
aliases: Lincoln Center Jazz Orchestra with Wynton Marsalis

name: Mark O'Connor
comments: Bluegrass, jazz, country, classical musician, and composer

name: Dicky Doo and The Don'ts
comments: Formed in 1958 as a vehicle for promoting Click Clack, a demo track created by Gerry Granahan and Dave Alldred.  At the time, Granahan was under contract to Atco and the record had been issued under the alias of Dicky Doo and the Don'ts.  When it became an unexpected hit, auditions were held for additional members and the group continued for several further releases.

name: Dicky Doo
comments: Rockabilly drummer and songwriter. Although Dicky Doo was an alias for Gerry Granahan when 'Dicky Doo and The Don'ts' were established, drummer Dave Alldred later adopted it as his own legal name.

name: James Yorkston
comments: Scottish singer-songwriter, also with a repertoire of traditional songs

name: Rock 'n' Roll Soldiers
comments: Punk rock band from Eugene, Oregon

name: Something Corporate
comments: Rock band from Orange County, California

name: NajwaJean
comments: Duo consisting of singer Najwa Nimri and musician Carlos Jean

name: Michel Vaucaire
comments: Lyricist, who often collaborated with the composer Charles Dumont

name: Cheb Mami
comments: Musician and singer-songwriter who was a significant figure in the introduction of raï music to Western audiences.

name: Clotilde Courau
comments: Princess Clotilde of Savoy, Princess of Venice and Piedmont née Clotilde Marie Pascale Courau is an actress, born in Hauts-de-Seine.

name: Dan Kelly [AU]
aliases: Dan Kelly and The Alpha Males

name: Sally Seltmann
comments: Indie pop singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and record producer

name: Glenn Thompson
comments: Musician and singer born in Albury, New South Wales

name: The Partchesz
comments: Bjorn Eriksson and Nathalie Delcroix a country and bluegrass duo with some supporting musicians

name: Mireille Mathieu
comments: Vocalist, who recorded over 1200 songs in eleven languages with more than 150 million albums sold worldwide.

name: Telly Savalas
comments: Principally an actor, Savalas also released several records as a singer of pop songs.

name: The Mauds
comments: Influential band in the 1960s Chicago music “garage band” scene
Sludge metal band from Los Angeles

name: George Goldner
comments: Record label owner, record producer and promoter, who played an important role in establishing the popularity of rock and roll in the 1950s.

name: Martha Veléz
personal_name: Martha Carmen Josephine Hernandéz Rosario de Veléz

name: Mumm-Ra
comments: Indie rock band from Bexhill on Sea. Active: 2000 - 2008 and 2012 - present.

name: Bruce Woodley
comments: Singer-songwriter and musician. He was a founding member of the pop-folk group The Seekers.

name: Keith Allen
comments: Actor, comedian, director, author, playwright, television presenter, artist, musician, singer-songwriter.

name: Plane Vanilla
comments: Defunkt Belgian band, that was best known for their live cover performance

name: No Mercy [US]
comments: Latin boy band formed by German producer Frank Farian

name: Bullet [US]
comments: Shortlived pop rock group. Released some singles in the early '70s.

name: The Mudlarks
comments: A brothers-and sister vocal trio from Luton, consisting of the siblings Fred, Jeff and Mary Mudd. Active till the middle of the 1960s.

name: Paul Rich
comments: Singer, musician and music publisher born in London

name: The Phantoms [NL]
comments: Early to mid-1960s rock & roll band from Eindhoven initally consisting of Roald van der Horst (guitar), Ad van der Ven (guitar) and Fred Gundlach (drums) when it was founded in 1962. They soon added Wally Sout (bass), and Martien van Rooy (vocals) to their lineup. By the summer of 1965, the Phantoms were successful enough to get a recording contract of their own.  The group made some inroads in Germany and England, but by 1969 they'd called it quits.

name: Chick Carlton
comments: Soul singer from Kansas City, Missouri

name: Intro
comments: R&B group from New York, USA.

name: Leny Andrade
comments: Jazz vocalist, she was dubbed the 'Ella Fitzgerald of Brazil' through her occasional scat singing.

name: Born Jamericans
comments: A reggae/hip hop duo formed in Washington, D.C., popular in the 1990s
